titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 743: Carmen paschale

notesStmt.note: Item 6, on Socrates, is unidentified, incipit: Socrates sanctum ac venerabile consilium nobis (f. 50r).
Item 10 incipit: In summis missis festorum Nativitate Christi, Pasche, & Penthecostes, una sola oratio solemniter...
Item 13 incipit: Monachus ditur quasi solus et plangens seu dolens... (f. 64r).

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Carmen paschale in four books, with a number of other poems, notes on the liturgy and verses in praise of monastic life.

msItem.title: Oratio quam dicitur edidisse Prudentius poeta, f. 48r
Epigrammata ex sententiis S. Augustini, excerpt on the nature of sin, f. 49r
Se totum invenit perfusum etiam pro verberibus quae, f. 51r
Summa quies nil velle supia qui postulat usus, f. 51v
Notes on the order of the liturgy, f. 59r
Prayer to Jesus Christ and Pro peccatis, f. 62r
Acrostic poem about monastic life, Carthusian, f. 64r
[Versus?] beati Thomae de Aquino de laude cellae, f. 65r
Historia de Transfiguratione domini salvatoris, f. 66r

supportDesc.extent: 66 leaves : 141 x 104 (103 x 73) mm. bound to 146 x 105 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i (modern paper) + i (near contemporary paper) + 66 + i (modern paper); [1-66]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 21 long lines; ruled in lead.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a German gothic script (f. 1-47), with additional texts in 5 other hands.

origin.p: Written in Germany in the second half of the 15th century (Zacour-Hirsch).

keywords.term: Catholic Church--Prayers and devotions--Early works to 1800
Monastic and religious life--Early works to 1800
Latin poetry, Medieval and modern--Early works to 1800
